Name: Brain Correlates of Multisensory Lexical Processing in Adults
ReferencesAndLinks: Brennan, C., Cao, F., Pedroareana-Leal, N., McNorgan, C. & Booth, J. R. Reading acquisition reorganizes the phonological awareness network only in alphabetic systems. Human Brain Mapping. 34, 3354-3368 (2013).
Cao, F., Brennan, C. & Booth, J. R. The brain adapts to orthography with experience: Evidence from English and Chinese. Developmental Science. 18, 785-798 (2015).
HowToAcknowledge:
Please cite this dataset as well as the corresponding developmental data descriptor for use of this dataset:
 
Lytle MN, McNorgan C & Booth JR (2020). Brain correlates of multisensory lexical processing in adults. OpenNeuro. 10.18112/openneuro.ds002879

Lytle MN, McNorgan C & Booth JR (2019). A longitudinal neuroimaging dataset on multisensory lexical processing in school-aged children. Scientific Data, 6, 329.
